Synopsis:
Meet George Dryer (Gerard Butler). In his day a renowned soccer star in Europe, now living virtually penniless in McLean, Virginia. It has come to this small suburban town to fix his relationship with his son, Lewis (Noah Lomax), who has seen sporadically in the five years that have passed since he broke up with his mother, Stacie (Jessica Biel). Despite having made mistakes in the past, now George wants to compensate them for the sake of your child and find a job that lets you live near him. In order to foster a positive relationship with your child, Stacie convinces George to train the small Lewis football team. What no one expects is the amount of attention that George will grab by the parents of the other team members!

First is Barb (Judy Greer), a divorcee who seek security still feel attractive. Then there's Denise (Catherine Zeta-Jones) a bored housewife while TV news announcer George wants to help by offering a lucrative job as a sports commentator. Then there is the sponsor of the team, the wealthy Carl King (Dennis Quaid), who quickly becomes his friend to show off to their partners on how close it is to the town sports celebrity. Even Carl's wife, Patti (Uma Thurman), who has remained faithful to her husband lying over the years, is launched to George because he sees in him what is Carl.

On the football field may George has control of the ball and children to coaching, but once off the turf, the countless distractions away to enjoy what you want to spend time with his son, Lewis. How will George focus on being a good father to Lewis and possibly getting back with Stacie when the rest are competing for your attention? What will George?
